title: Why can some players not get ranked suspensions until they improve?
body: If a player is so bad that having them on your team is a loss 99% of the time, why can they not get a ranked suspension until they improve? Realistically if a player is going 2/23 in a bronze 5 game trying their hardest, ranked is obviously not the place for them. They need a lot of practice, and ranked should be out of the question if they dont even have the basics of the game like csing, pinging, or, well, anything. A system i would have in mind is if a player is performing like this in numerous games over and over, they have a week suspension and until they show improvement they get to do placement type of games to prove they are ready for ranked which would be available once a week.

> If a player is so bad that having them on your team is a loss 99% of the time, why can they not get a ranked suspension until they improve?

Because if they **really** have such an abysmal winrate over a significant amount of games they will play against people who would not have done any better in their place.
People do extremely badly when they are matched against far better players. Punishing people because Riot didn't find them a proper match seems beyond ridiculous.

Edit: I mean, just consider what usually happens within the first week after the soft reset. Lots of lopsided matches that are simply created by matchmaking having to cope with people climbing and falling back to where they belong. You could have lots of gold players screwed over completely by bad luck, who on top of this might then get suspended in ranked... and for what? For performing on their average level while being matched against people that before the reset were ranked plat and diamond?
